title: You’re building a keyword recognition model that requires word-level information from a spoken audio file. Your job is to extract the full transcription and break it into individual words for use in training.
description:
Write a Python script to process the audio file input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Use the speech_recognition library to load and process the audio file.
2.	Transcribe speech using the recognize_google () function.
3.	Split the transcription into individual words.
4.	Export the result to a CSV file named solution.csv, containing a single column listing each word.
5.	Display only the first 5 rows of the output on the screen.

parts.description:

5.	Display only the first 5 rows of the output on the screen.

title: Your team is working on a speaker diarization task and needs utterance-level transcriptions to align speech with timestamps. You must divide the audio into smaller time-based chunks and transcribe each one individually.
description:
Write a Python script to process input.wav and generate chunk-based speech transcriptions. Your program must:
1.	Load the audio file and divide it into 1-second chunks.
2.	Use the speech_recognition library with the recognize_google() function to transcribe each chunk.
3.	Handle silent or unrecognized segments by inserting "Unrecognized or Silent" in the transcript field.
4.	Export the results to a CSV file named solution.csv with the following columns:
ChunkID, StartTime (s), EndTime (s), and Transcript.
5.	Display the first 5 rows of the output for verification.

5.	Display the first 5 rows of the output for verification.

title: You are starting with a simple speech recognition task.
description:
Write a Python script to process the audio file input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Load the file using the speech_recognition library.
2.	Use the Google Web Speech API to transcribe the audio.
3.	Print the complete transcription text.
4.	Save the transcription to a text file named solution.csv.

parts.description:

1.	Load the file using the speech_recognition library.
2.	Use the Google Web Speech API to transcribe the audio.
3.	Print the complete transcription text.
4.	Save the transcription to a text file named solution.csv.

title: You are building a robust transcription tool.
description:
Write a Python script to process the audio file input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Load the audio using speech_recognition.AudioFile().
2.	Transcribe the speech using recognize_google().
3.	Handle exceptions such as network errors or unintelligible speech gracefully.
4.	Print “No speech detected” if transcription fails.
5.	Save the recognized text (if available) to solution.csv.

parts.description:

1.	Load the audio using speech_recognition.AudioFile().
2.	Transcribe the speech using recognize_google().
3.	Handle exceptions such as network errors or unintelligible speech gracefully.
4.	Print “No speech detected” if transcription fails.
5.	Save the recognized text (if available) to solution.csv.

title: You are converting spoken content into structured text.
description:
Write a Python script to process input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Use speech_recognition to transcribe the full audio file.
2.	Split the transcribed text into individual sentences using nltk.sent_tokenize().
3.	Export each sentence as a separate row in a CSV file named solution.csv.
4.	Display the first 5 sentences as output.

parts.description:

2.	Split the transcribed text into individual sentences using nltk.sent_tokenize().
3.	Export each sentence as a separate row in a CSV file named solution.csv.
4.	Display the first 5 sentences as output.

title: You want to identify important terms from an audio transcription.
description:
Write a Python script to process input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Transcribe the audio using the Google Web Speech API.
2.	Split the text into individual words.
3.	Count word frequencies using collections.Counter.
4.	Print the top 5 most frequent keywords and export them to solution.csv.

parts.description:
Write a Python script to process input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Transcribe the audio using the Google Web Speech API.
2.	Split the text into individual words.
3.	Count word frequencies using collections.Counter.
4.	Print the top 5 most frequent keywords and export them to solution.csv.

title: You are developing a Python program to analyze and process an audio file named input.wav. The goal is to divide the file into smaller segments and automatically generate transcriptions for each part.
description:
Write a Python script that must perform the following steps:
1.	Load the audio file using the pydub library.
2.	Split the audio into 1-second chunks.
3.	Use the speech_recognition library with the Google Speech API to transcribe each chunk separately.
4.	Handle silent or unrecognized chunks gracefully by marking them as "Unrecognized or Silent".
5.	Save all results into a CSV file named solution.csv with the columns:
o	ChunkID, StartTime(s), EndTime(s), Transcript.
6.	Display the first 3 rows of the CSV output for verification.

parts.description:

5.	Save all results into a CSV file named solution.csv with the columns:
o	ChunkID, StartTime(s), EndTime(s), Transcript.
6.	Display the first 3 rows of the CSV output for verification.

title: You are analyzing a conversation between two speakers.
description:
Write a Python script to process input.wav. Your program must:
1.	Load and split the audio into 2-second chunks.
2.	Use the Google Web Speech API to transcribe each chunk.
3.	Tag each chunk as “Speaker 1” or “Speaker 2” alternately.
4.	Save the output to solution.csv with columns: Speaker, StartTime(s), EndTime(s), Transcript.
5.	Display the first 4 rows of the CSV file.

parts.description:

4.	Save the output to solution.csv with columns: Speaker, StartTime(s), EndTime(s), Transcript.
5.	Display the first 4 rows of the CSV file.

title: You are developing a voice-based command detection system that can identify multiple predefined keywords spoken in an audio clip.
description:
Write a Python script to process an audio file named input.wav and perform the following tasks:
1.	Transcribe the audio using the speech_recognition library and the Google Speech API.
2.	Detect all commands from the recognized text that match any of the predefined keywords in the list:
["of", "the", "is", "spot", "machine", "human", "voices"]
3.	Display all detected commands, or show the message "No valid command found" if none are detected.
4.	Save the full recognized text and the detected commands to a CSV file named solution.csv.
5.	Print the output in a structured format showing both the transcription and the detected commands.
